text: What is the primary purpose of a dynamic warm-up before an MMA training session?

options.text: To increase static flexibility as much as possible.
To elevate core body temperature and increase blood flow to muscles.
To primarily build muscle strength before technical drills.
To practice holding isometric positions for extended periods.

feedback: Dynamic warm-ups prepare the body for strenuous activity by increasing temperature, blood flow, and activating the neuromuscular system, reducing injury risk.
source_reference: Coaching Manual - Section on Athlete Preparation & Safety

text: Which of these is a common overuse injury in MMA fighters, often related to repetitive striking or grappling movements?
feedback: Shoulder impingement is often an overuse injury resulting from repetitive overhead movements or strain common in MMA training.
source_reference: Sports Medicine for MMA - Chapter on Common Injuries

text: For sparring, 16oz gloves are generally recommended for adult male athletes to provide adequate protection for both sparring partners.
feedback: Heavier gloves like 16oz are standard for sparring to minimize impact force and reduce the risk of injury to both participants.
